page.description: A run down on how to set different UX properties.

step.description: Selecting Layout Options > Style name > '...' button > Select style displays the Select style dialog box. You can preview and select the Cascading Style Sheet that you would like to apply to the grid.

Selecting Layout Options > Style name >'...' button > Edit Style displays the Webform Style Builder. Here you can save a style with a new name, then edit its characteristics to create a new stylesheet that will appear in the Select style dialog box.

section.description: Clicking the 'up' button on the Style drop down list displays the Select style dialog box. You can preview and select the Cascading Style Sheet that you would like to apply to the grid. Clicking Edit Style displays the Webform Style Builder. Here you can save a style with a new name, then edit its characteristics to create a new stylesheet that will appear in the Select style dialog box.

case.title: Layout Calculation Mode
case.description: Enables alternate processing modes that can enhance performance. The options are:
"Standard"
"Precalculate Layout"

case.title: Stylesheet
case.description: Specifies the name of the stylesheet.

case.title: Component Name
case.description: Specifies the name of the component.

case.title: Validate before submit
case.description: This setting allows you to validate data on the form before the form is submitted. This requires Javascript to be enabled on the client browser. Rules for each control are defined in the Validation Rules for each control. Enable client side validation for each control by checking the Client side validation check box on the Controls page.

case.title: Freeform layout
case.description: Will there be a freeform layout?

case.title: Dialog footer template
case.description: Specifies the buttons and formatting of the dialog footer.

case.title: Above dialog
case.description: HTML to appear above the dialog component.

case.title: Below dialog
case.description: HTML to appear below the dialog component.

case.title: Left of dialog
case.description: HTML to appear to the left of the dialog component.

case.title: Right of dialog
case.description: HTML to appear to the right of the dialog component.

case.title: Font size
case.description: Specify if the fonts in the Web Component should be scaled to make the Web Component larger or smaller. Select 'Medium' for no scaling (i.e. the fonts shown will match those defined in the style sheet). The options are:
"Smallest"
"Smaller"
"Medium"
"Larger"
"Largest"

case.title: Show row labels
case.description: Enables or disables the display of labels next to each control.

case.title: Position of field error messages
case.description: Specify whether field validation error messages should be grouped together in the form header, or shown underneath the controls that have errors. The options are:
"Form Header"
"Next to Control"

case.title: Number of "Layout" Columns
case.description: Display the controls of the dialog in more than 1 column.

case.title: Use Free-Form Layout
case.description: Indicate that you want to create a free-form layout.

case.title: Free-Form Layout
case.description: The HTML that defines the free-form layout.

case.title: Has Submit button
case.description: Does this dialog have a Submit button?

case.title: Submit button label
case.description: Label for the Submit button.

case.title: Submit button in-line style
case.description: Specify style attributes that override the settings inherited from the style sheet. Click to display the Style Editor.

case.title: Has Reset button
case.description: Does this dialog have a Reset button?

case.title: Reset button label
case.description: Label for the Reset button.

case.title: Reset button in-line style
case.description: Specify style attributes that override the settings inherited from the style sheet. Click to display the Style Editor.

case.title: Align
case.description: Specifies whether to align buttons at the left or right edge of the dialog.

section.title: Server Events

case.title: Declarations
case.description: Use the Declarations section to define any User Defined Functions that you want to be available to all Xbasic event code. Click '...' to open the Form Events dialog box.

case.title: Initialize
case.description: The Initialize event fires the first time the form is run. The Initialize event is not fired when the form is run the second and subsequent times or when the form is submitted to itself. Click '...' to open the Form Events dialog box.

case.title: Validate
case.description: The Validate event fires every time the form is submitted. It is the first event that fires when the form is submitted to itself. If the code in the Validate event sets the Has_Error property of any object on the form to .T., Alpha Anywhere re-displays the form so that the user can correct errors, and then re-submit the form. Click '...' to open the Form Events dialog box.

case.title: AfterValidate
case.description: The AfterValidate event fires after the Validate event, but only if the Validate event code did not set any control's Has_Error property to .T. Click '...' to open the Form Events dialog box.

case.title: Activate
case.description: The Activate event fires every time the form is run. The Activate event fires after the Validate and AfterValidate events. Click '...' to open the Form Events dialog box.

section.note: If you are writing your own Xbasic on a .A5W page, then to redirect to another page you use the RESPONSE.REDIRECT() method. However, if you are writing code in a Version 6 dialog event handler (such as AfterValidate ) in a component, you cannot use RESPONSE.REDIRECT(). Instead you must set the currentform.redirectTarget = "target url" property.
